snippet: Though talks made little headway, negotiators did discuss an American proposal to accelerate the transfer of detention centers in the country to the Afghans to as soon as six months.
abstract: United States and Afghanistan appear to make no headway in high-level negotiations on a long-term strategic partnership that have been embittered somewhat by the Koran burnings in February.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and an employee of The New York Times from Nangahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Though talks made little headway, negotiators did discuss an American proposal to accelerate the transfer of detention centers in the country to the Afghans to as soon as six months.

headline.main: No Sign of Progress in Afghanistan Talks Embittered by Koran Burnings
headline.print_headline: No Sign of Progress in Afghanistan Talks Embittered by Koran Burnings
